CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Fan Engagement stage positioned above or below the Event Announcement stage?
SRP.A: The Fan Engagement stage is positioned {below} the Event Announcement stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Event Announcement?
VE.A: The value of stage Event Announcement is {1291}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Event Attendance?
VE.A: The value of stage Event Attendance is {826}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Event Announcement, with a value of {1291}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Post-Event Feedback, with a value of {369}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Fan Engagement to stage Post-Event Feedback?
SC.A: Decreased by {228} Participants from stage Fan Engagement to stage Post-Event Feedback.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 711? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Event Announcement} stage has {1291}, the {Ticket Purchase} stage has {1059}, the {Event Attendance} stage has {826}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 942? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Event Attendance} stage has {826}, the {Fan Engagement} stage has {597}, the {Post-Event Feedback} stage has {369}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 711 and 942? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Ticket Purchase to Event Attendance, or from stage Event Attendance to Fan Engagement?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Ticket Purchase} to {Event Attendance} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Event Attendance to Fan Engagement, or from stage Event Announcement to Ticket Purchase?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Event Announcement} to {Ticket Purchase} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Event Attendance to Fan Engagement, from stage Fan Engagement to Post-Event Feedback, or from stage Ticket Purchase to Event Attendance?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Ticket Purchase} to stage {Event Attendance} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Ticket Purchase} and {Event Attendance} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Fan Engagement} and {Post-Event Feedback} stages.
